events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving rear-end collision on the highway during rush hour, resulting in vehicle damage.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on keywords found in the initial report and police documentation.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to coordinate further investigation and communication with the claimant.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the accident claim and informed the customer of next steps.
Documents requested included police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and medical reports for any injuries sustained.
The claimant submitted all requested documents promptly including detailed images of vehicle damage and accident report.
Investigation into the collision details and liability commenced by the insurance adjuster assigned to this claim.
Investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault, corroborated by witness statements and police report.
A settlement proposal was sent to the claimant covering the full repair costs and medical expenses arising from the accident.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of the claim.
The claim was formally approved by the claims department following successful review of investigation and customer agreement.
Full payment for vehicle repairs and related medical bills was issued to the claimant as per the approved settlement terms.
The claim file has been closed after payment issuance and confirmation that all claimant concerns were addressed.
